channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain cover sinking into the pavement on Shakespeare, 6th March
item.description:
This drain cover has been sinking into the pavement and now has a 2 inch lift at the edge which is a trip hazard please could someone come and take a look at it?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 81 Shakespeare Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Failing (?) retaining wall, 5th March
item.description:
A section of the retaining wall on the Honeybourne Line path looks to be failing. Previously-rebuilt section (it's blockwork, rather than original blue railway brickwork) has moved. Possibly been like this for many years, but the top half of the wall has clearly moved / slipped, and is now leaning outwards in places. Immediately adjacent to the bottom of the access ramp leading from Queens Road down onto the main path. Is anybody aware of this / monitoring it? If it fails it could cause a slump in the railway cutting slope behind the wall. If not already being monitored, suggest a Structural Engineer needs to have a look at it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Eldorado Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead badger, 5th March
item.description:
There is a dead badger at the bottom of the railway embankment, adjacent to the Honeybourne Line path. Between lamp posts 22 & 23 - approx. 5 metres from post 23. Clearly visible from the path. Been there at least a week - first seen afternoon of Friday 25th Feb. Reported via telephone to CBC at 12.40pm on Monday 28th Feb. Still there at 8.20am today (Sat 5th March).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 Brickfield Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
